name: 陳琬萍
objective:
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. The content of Calculus(I)
includes: 1.Functions and Limits, 2.Derivatives, 3.Inverse Functions (includes 
Transcendental Functions), 4.Applications of Differentiation, 5.Integrals,
6.Techniques of Integration.
schedule:
Week 1 ---Functions, The limit of a function, Calculating limits
Week 2 ---Continuity, Limits involving infinity
Week 3 ---Derivatives and rates of change, The derivative as a function,
         Basic differentiation formulas, The product and quotient rules
Week 4 ---The chain rule, Implicit differentiation, Related rates,
         Linear approximations and differentials
Week 5 ---Exponential functions, Inverse functions and Logarithms,
        Derivatives of Logarithmic and Exponential functions
Week 6 ---Test1
Week 7 ---Exponential Growth and Decay, Hyperbolic functions, Indeterminate forms and L’Hospital’s rule
Week 8 ---Maximum and minimum values, The mean value theorem
Week 9 ---Derivatives and the shapes of graphs
Week 10 –Curve sketching
Week 11 –Optimization problems, Newton’s method, Antiderivatives
Week 12 –Test2
Week 13 –Areas and distances, The definite integral, Evaluating definite integrals
Week 14 –The fundamental theorem of calculus, The substitution rule
Week 15 –Integration by parts, Trigonometric integrals and substitutions
Week 16 –Partial fractions, Integration with tables, Approximate integration
Week 17 –Improper integrals
Week 18 –Final exam
scorePolicy:
1. Attendance 15%
2. Homework & Exercises 20%
3. Test1 20%
4. Test2 20%
5. Final 25%
